org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy

Class CanaryStrategy<C extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy.InterruptableStrategy<C>
      • org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy.SerialStrategy<C>
        • org.apache.mesos.scheduler.plan.strategy.CanaryStrategy<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - is the type of Elements to which the Strategy applies.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Strategy<C>

    public class CanaryStrategy<C extends Element>
extends SerialStrategy<C>
    A CanaryStrategy blocks deployment entirely by default until human intervention through the proceed() call. After a single proceed() call it again blocks until human intervention. Any further calls to proceed() will indicate the strategy should continue without further intervention.

      • proceed

        public void proceed()
        Description copied from interface: Strategy
        If a Strategy is interrupted this should now allow a Strategy to produce candidates on calls to Strategy.getCandidates(Element, Collection). If the Strategy was already interrupted a call to proceed should have no effect.
        Specified by:
        proceed in interface Strategy<C extends Element>
        Overrides:
        proceed in class InterruptableStrategy<C extends Element>
